New Records: Jude Bellingham scored the equalizer for England with the last kick of the game
Key Match Events: Jude Bellingham scored the equalizer for England with the last kick of the game
Kobbie Mainoo had a strong performance for England
Ivan Toney scored his first goal for England from the penalty spot
Youri Tielemans scored a brace for Belgium
Wales were beaten on penalties by Poland in the play-off
Pre-Game Insights: Kobbie Mainoo and Ivan Toney were set to start for England
Gareth Southgate was making big changes for England
Declan Rice was set to captain England for his 50th cap
Wales were looking to reach their third European Championships in a row
Poland were looking to cause problems with Robert Lewandowski leading the line
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate will be happy that England managed to evade two losses in a row
Ivan Toney put in a performance worthy of being rewarded with a ticket to Germany in the summer
Kobbie Mainoo could have a strong case to start at the Euros in the summer
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in honor of Alzheimer's Society
The England team wore nameless shirts to bring attention to how people with dementia lose precious memories
